colourconvert.cpp

00001 /*
00002  * colourconvert.cpp
00003  *
00004  *  Created on: 18.03.2009
00005  *      Author: gerstrong
00006  */
00007 
00008 #include <SDL.h>
00009 
00010 /**
00011  * \brief This function fades one color channel to c_dest
00012  * \param c  Color channel it will get
00013  * \param c_dest Destination color to where the colour we want to get
00014  */
00015 void fadecolorChannel(Uint8 &c, Uint8 c_dest, Uint8 speed)
00016 {
00017  Sint16 c16 = c;
00018  if( c16<c_dest )
00019  {
00020   c16 += speed;
00021   if( c16>c_dest )
00022    c16 = c_dest;
00023  }
00024  else if( c16>c_dest )
00025  {
00026   c16 -= speed;
00027   if( c16<c_dest )
00028    c16 = c_dest;
00029  }
00030 
00031  if(c16 > 255)
00032   c = 0xFF;
00033  if(c16 < 0)
00034   c = 0;
00035  else
00036   c = static_cast<Uint8>(c16);
00037 }
00038 
00039 /**
00040  * \brief This function fades the entire color to m_colour
00041  * \param m_colour Color it will get
00042  * \param dest_colour Destination color to where the color we want to get
00043  * \param speed  fading speed
00044  */
00045 void fadetoColour(Uint32 &m_colour, Uint32 dest_colour, Uint8 speed)
00046 {
00047  Uint8 r, g, b;
00048  Uint8 r_dest, g_dest, b_dest;
00049 
00050  if(m_colour == dest_colour)
00051   return;
00052 
00053  // Get the colour components. As the operations are relative
00054  // we don't need to care about endianess.
00055  r = (m_colour & 0xFF0000) >> 16;
00056  g = (m_colour & 0x00FF00) >> 8;
00057  b = (m_colour & 0x0000FF);
00058 
00059  r_dest = (dest_colour & 0xFF0000) >> 16;
00060  g_dest = (dest_colour & 0x00FF00) >> 8;
00061  b_dest = (dest_colour & 0x0000FF);
00062 
00063  fadecolorChannel(r, r_dest, speed);
00064  fadecolorChannel(g, g_dest, speed);
00065  fadecolorChannel(b, b_dest, speed);
00066 
00067  m_colour = static_cast<Uint32>(r)<<16;
00068  m_colour += static_cast<Uint32>(g)<<8;
00069  m_colour += static_cast<Uint32>(b);
00070 }
00071 
00072 /**
00073  * \brief This function merges every pixel of src to the dst.
00074  *     I think it is the same as BlitSurface by SDL, but in some
00075  *     cases that version cannot Apply the Alpha channel.
00076  *     If someone get's an idea how to get it working, he is welcome
00077  *     I searched high and low in the SDL documentation and got Lost...
00078  *     This only does an OR operation on the surface, so be careful!
00079  */
00080 void BlitSurfaceMerge( SDL_Surface *src, SDL_Rect *p_src_rect, SDL_Surface *dst, SDL_Rect *p_dst_rect )
00081 {
00082  SDL_LockSurface(src);
00083  SDL_LockSurface(dst);
00084 
00085  SDL_Rect src_rect, dst_rect;
00086 
00087  if(p_src_rect == NULL)
00088  {
00089   src_rect.x = src_rect.y = 0;
00090   src_rect.h = src->h;
00091   src_rect.w = src->w;
00092  }
00093  else
00094   src_rect = *p_src_rect;
00095 
00096  if(p_dst_rect == NULL)
00097  {
00098   dst_rect.x = dst_rect.y = 0;
00099   dst_rect.h = dst->h;
00100   dst_rect.w = dst->w;
00101  }
00102  else
00103   dst_rect = *p_dst_rect;
00104 
00105 
00106  // trim clipping rects
00107  if( dst->h < dst_rect.y+dst_rect.h  )
00108   src_rect.h = dst->h-dst_rect.y;
00109 
00110  if( dst->w < dst_rect.x+dst_rect.w  )
00111   src_rect.w = dst->w-dst_rect.x;
00112 
00113  Uint8 *pixel_src;
00114  Uint8 *pixel_dst;
00115  Uint8 sr,sg,sb,sa;
00116  Uint8 dr,dg,db,da;
00117  Uint32 *pixel_src32;
00118  Uint32 *pixel_dst32;
00119 
00120  for( size_t y=0 ; y<src_rect.h ; y++ )
00121  {
00122   pixel_src = (Uint8*)src->pixels + (src_rect.x)*src->format->BytesPerPixel + (src_rect.y+y)*src->pitch;
00123   pixel_dst = (Uint8*)dst->pixels + (dst_rect.x)*dst->format->BytesPerPixel + (dst_rect.y+y)*dst->pitch;
00124 
00125   for( size_t x=0 ; x<src_rect.w ; x++ )
00126   {
00127    pixel_src32 = (Uint32*)pixel_src;
00128    pixel_dst32 = (Uint32*)pixel_dst;
00129    SDL_GetRGBA(*pixel_src32, src->format, &sr, &sg, &sb, &sa);
00130    SDL_GetRGBA(*pixel_dst32, dst->format, &dr, &dg, &db, &da);
00131 
00132    dr |= sr;
00133    dg |= sg;
00134    db |= sb;
00135    da |= sa;
00136    *pixel_dst32 = SDL_MapRGBA(dst->format, dr, dg, db, da);
00137    pixel_src+=src->format->BytesPerPixel;
00138    pixel_dst+=dst->format->BytesPerPixel;
00139   }
00140  }
00141 
00142  SDL_UnlockSurface(dst);
00143  SDL_UnlockSurface(src);
00144 }
